overview: Searching  for the roots of Peter Greenaway in his films, this artful documentary begins with a workshop from 1991 in which Peter Greenaway discusses his film career, from his early short Revolution (1968) to The Cook,  The Thief, His Wife and Her Lover (1989). Including a rare and exclusive behind-the-scenes featurette "A Walk  Through Prospero's Library", with Greenaway discussing the inspiration for his classic film, Prospero's Books (1991).
title: Peter Greenaway: A Documentary
